entry.title: Re: RF Multi HU Picking
entry.content:
Hello @Eric_SAUTOT64 

Thank you for your question, and I got it. What you’re seeing is standard behaviour of the RF Multi-HU Picking by WO flow in Public Warehouse Management S/4HANA Public cloud.

That flow is designed to:

 Scan all source HUs at the pick bin, then scan the destination bin once and drop them together.

If you want to scan the destination for each HU (HU → dest → next HU → dest…), you have three workable options:

Option 1 — Use a single-HU picking flow (no customising).

In the RF menu, select Picking by WO (single HU) or Picking by WT instead of the Multi-HU option. These flows confirm each handling unit individually and prompt for the destination after each HU.

Option 2 — Copy the RF logical transaction and change the step sequence

If you need to maintain a WO-based flow but confirm HU-by-HU.

  •  Copy the delivered Picking by WO – Multi HU logical transaction into the RF Framework configuration.
  •  In the step sequence, insert the Destination Bin step after each HU verification so the loop becomes: Source → Scan HU → Destination → Confirm → repeat.
  • Assign your Z* logical transaction to the RF menu/profile.

Public Cloud allows RF Framework configuration menus, logical transactions, and step sequences, enabling you to customise the confirmation sequence without core modifications.

Option 3 — Split work so each HU is its own WO

Adjust warehouse order creation rules so the system doesn’t group multiple HUs into a single WO (or at least maintains one HU per WO/destination). Then, even with the standard flow, you’ll naturally process HU → destination per WO.

Quick decision guide

  • Need it fast with no config? Option 1 (single-HU / by WT).
  • Need the same WO-based UI but per-HU drops? Option 2 (copy and tweak the RF logical transaction).
  • Operationally prefer one HU per trip. Option 3 (WOCR split).

If you tell me your warehouse order creation rule and which RF menu you’re using, I’ll sketch the exact step sequence to switch from scanning all HUs, then dest to HU → dest → HU → dest.

Let me know if you need futher support

With kind regards

Chuma Ofole

 

GenAI assist content SAP Useful references(Here are solid references you can cite for each point)

  • Multi-HU picking behaviour (one destination after multiple HUs): SAP Help – Placing Multiple Handling Units (explains optimising HU placements for one WO in RF picking). SAP Help Placing Multiple Handling Units
  • Picking configuration topics (RF flows incl. picking/packing/counting): SAP Help – Configuration for Picking (section list includes Placing Multiple Handling Units). SAP Help Configuration for Picking
  • Warehouse Order Creation Rules (to split WO so you can do HU → dest per WO): SAP Help – Configuration for Warehouse Order Creation and Warehouse Order Creation overview. SAP Help -Configuration for Warehouse Order Creation
  • RF in Public Cloud (capabilities, delivered transactions): SAP micro-learning – Introducing Radio Frequency Framework for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Supply Chain. SAP Learning-Introducing Radio Frequency Framework for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Supply Chain
  • Scope activation for RF (standard RF works in S/4HANA Public Cloud without BTP add-ons): SAP Community Q&A for scope item 63V – Mobile RF Devices in Warehousing. SAP Community

These support the options I suggested use single-HU/WT flow, copy the RF logical transaction to alter the step sequence, or split WOs via WOCR).

entry.title: A simple example of a SAP RAP Application based on Legacy API without UUID keys
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP RAP, it is very easy to develop an application when the entities involved use UUIDs as keys. However, there are lots of legacy APIs and data models that does not have these type of keys. Usually this legacy APIs have the following characteristics in common:

  • They have a CREATE operation that generates the entity (and subentities) in one call. The successful execution of this create operation generates the new entity Id (e.g. BAPI_PO_CREATE1 with internal numbering)
  • They have an UPDATE operation that changes the entity (and subentities) in one call. Usually this operation contains  BAPIUPDATE structures to indicate which fields are being changed (e.g. BAPI_PO_CHANGE).
  • Somentimes they have a DELETE operation.

Although RAP framework allows to reuse these objects, I had some doubts when implementing my first real cases (when to call each API Operation, for example), so I write this blog in order to summarize my findings and provide a simple example of an RAP application with a UI that allows to execute CRUD operations in an entity that has a Legacy API to maintain it. 

In order to keep things simple and do not depend in the specific configuration of any system, the development has been based in the Unmanaged Transactional App example of the ABAP Restful Programming Model Documentation (Developing Unmanaged Transactional Apps), although in our case we will implement a managed app with unmanaged save and late numbering. Also, only the relevant elements for the example have been included in this article, not covering other elements that are similar to the Unmanaged Transactional App Example (Behavior Projection, Projection Views, Metadata Extensions, etc...). The complete source code of the application can be found in this GitHub repository: https://github.com/cesarsn/RAP-LateNumbering-UnmanagedSave.git

Mor information can be found in the following blogs that were used as reference along with SAP Help:

  • Using BAPIs in RAP by Marcel Hermanns
  • Exposing BAPI as OData API using RAP Facade  by Marcel Wahl

 

Legacy Data Model

As was stated previously, in order to do the example, we will use the Flight Reference Scenario of SAP RAP (https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-refscen-flight), using the legacy objects that are defined in package /DMO/FLIGHT_LEGACY.  We will use the following API function modules to maintain Travels (table /DMO/TRAVEL) and Bookings (table /DMO/BOOKING): 

  • /DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_CREATE: creates a new travel (and bookings).
  • /DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_UPDATE: updates a travel (and its bookings)
  • /DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_DELETE: deletes a travel (and its bookings)

For this example, we will try to avoid numbering gaps when creating travels, and  the user should be allowed to manually inform the booking id during creation of a new booking (similar to giving the item id for the Purchase Order or Sales Order), with the system proposing next booking id to be used.

 

RAP Entities

Travel data

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Travel data'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity ZI_Travel_U_CSN 
  as select from /dmo/travel as Travel -- the travel table is the data source for this view
  composition [0..*] of ZI_Booking_U_CSN as _Booking
  association [0..1] to /DMO/I_Agency    as _Agency   on $projection.AgencyID = _Agency.AgencyID
  association [0..1] to /DMO/I_Customer  as _Customer on $projection.CustomerID = _Customer.CustomerID
  association [0..1] to I_Currency       as _Currency on $projection.CurrencyCode = _Currency.Currency
  association [1..1] to /DMO/I_Travel_Status_VH as _TravelStatus on $projection.Status = _TravelStatus.TravelStatus
{
    
  key Travel.travel_id     as TravelID,
      Travel.agency_id     as AgencyID,
      Travel.customer_id   as CustomerID,
      Travel.begin_date    as BeginDate,
      Travel.end_date      as EndDate,    
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'CurrencyCode'
      Travel.booking_fee   as BookingFee,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'CurrencyCode'
      Travel.total_price   as TotalPrice,
      Travel.currency_code as CurrencyCode,
      Travel.description   as Memo,
      Travel.status        as Status,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true 
      cast( '0' as abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl ) as LocalLastChangeDateTime,
      Travel.createdat as CreatedAt,
      Travel.createdby as CreatedBy,
      Travel.lastchangedat as LastChangedAt,
      Travel.lastchangedby as LastChangedBy,
      /* Associations */
      _Booking,
      _Agency,
      _Customer,
      _Currency,
      _TravelStatus
}

It has been added a fixed value for attribute LocalLastChangeDateTime as this will be the local Etag field that will be used in draft entity.

Booking Data

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Booking data'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity ZI_Booking_U_CSN 
  as select from /dmo/booking as Booking
  association        to parent ZI_Travel_U_CSN     as _Travel     on  $projection.TravelID = _Travel.TravelID
  association [1..1] to /DMO/I_Customer            as _Customer   on  $projection.CustomerID = _Customer.CustomerID
  association [1..1] to /DMO/I_Carrier             as _Carrier    on  $projection.AirlineID = _Carrier.AirlineID
  association [1..1] to /DMO/I_Connection          as _Connection on  $projection.AirlineID    = _Connection.AirlineID
                                                                  and $projection.ConnectionID = _Connection.ConnectionID
{
  key Booking.travel_id     as TravelID,
  key Booking.booking_id    as BookingID,
      Booking.booking_date  as BookingDate,
      Booking.customer_id   as CustomerID,
      Booking.carrier_id    as AirlineID,
      Booking.connection_id as ConnectionID,
      Booking.flight_date   as FlightDate,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'CurrencyCode'
      Booking.flight_price  as FlightPrice,
      Booking.currency_code as CurrencyCode,
      /* Associations */
      _Travel,
      _Customer,
      _Carrier,
      _Connection
}

Take into account that natural keys have been chosen (TravelId and BookingId) for this entity. This will have and impact in our numbering procedure as will be explained later.

 

Behavior Definition

The Behavior Definition of this BO is as follows:

managed implementation in class zbp_i_travel_u_csn unique;
strict ( 2 );
with draft;

define behavior for ZI_Travel_U_CSN alias Travel
with unmanaged save
draft table ZITRVL_UCSND
lock master
total etag LastChangedAt
authorization master ( instance )
etag master LocalLastChangeDateTime
late numbering
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly ) TravelID;
  association _Booking { create {default function GetDefaultsForBookings;} with draft;  }

  draft action Edit;
  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;

  mapping for /dmo/s_travel_in
  control /dmo/s_travel_intx
    {
      AgencyID      = agency_id;
      BeginDate     = begin_date;
      BookingFee    = booking_fee;
      CurrencyCode  = currency_code;
      CustomerID    = customer_id;
      EndDate       = end_date;
      Memo          = description;
      Status        = status;
      TotalPrice    = total_price;
      TravelID      = travel_id;
    }
}

define behavior for ZI_Booking_U_CSN alias Booking
with unmanaged save
draft table ZIBKNG_UCSND
lock dependent by _Travel
authorization dependent by _Travel
etag dependent by _Travel
late numbering
{
  update;
  delete;
  field ( readonly ) TravelID;
  field (readonly:update) BookingID;

  association _Travel {with draft;}

  mapping for /DMO/S_BOOKING_IN control /dmo/s_booking_intx
    {
      AirlineID    = carrier_id;
      BookingDate  = booking_date;
      BookingID    = booking_id;
      ConnectionID = connection_id;
      CurrencyCode = currency_code;
      CustomerID   = customer_id;
      FlightDate   = flight_date;
      FlightPrice  = flight_price;
      TravelID     = travel_id;
    }
}

Take into account that in order to keep the example simple and focus on the updating logic, we do not include any validation or determination that will improve the usability of the application (for example mandatory fields, date coherence checks, etc...).

Let us check now the relevant points of this Behavior Definition.

Managed Implementation with Unmanaged Save

Being the application Managed allows us to avoid all the coding that has to be implemented in an unmanaged applicationm and at the same time be able to reuse the API functions when saving data with the Unmanaged Save.

From my point of view, this is the easiest option to develop and app when we have a Legacy API: the runtime takes care of all the logic to create/update the entities during the interaction phase, while we can focus on business logic and fine tuning the application by using determinations, validations, side effects, ect... 

Late Numbering

In our case, Travel entity is created by API function /DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_CREATE with the id of the Travel being generated in this call.  As we prefer not to have gaps in our application, we are forced to use Late Numbering (as with Early Numbering an assigned travel Id will be lost if the user discards the draft during creation). This decission has however the following implications:

  • Draft table will have a new key field (draftuuid) that allows the assigment of a temporary key during entity creation. This is traslated to OData entity, where we have one additional key attribute (DraftUUID).  Take into account that DraftUUID is only informed by the runtime when creating new entities. When editing an existing entity it will be empty.
  • As Booking entity includes Key fields of the Tavel Key (TravelId), this forces us to define also Late Numbering for this entity. 

Other relevant points

  • As an UI App will be generated, draft handling is defined for this BO.
  • It is included a mapping for the structures that uses our API functions (both for actual values and for updated flags).
  • As we want to propose next booking id for the user when creating a Booking entity, we define a defaults function GetDefaultsForBookings for the "create by association" operation.

 

Behavior Implementation

Behavior is implemented with Behavior Pool zbp_i_travel_u_csn. Let us check the relevant elements for Local Types include, when the RAP BO Business Logic is defined.

Handler class LHC_TRAVEL

This class correspond to Business Logic of entity Travel.  

CLASS lhc_Travel DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR Travel RESULT result.

    METHODS GetDefaultsForBookings FOR READ
      IMPORTING keys FOR FUNCTION Travel~GetDefaultsForBookings RESULT result.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_Travel IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
    "To-do: Implement instance authorization
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD GetDefaultsForBookings.
    "This method will default the id of the new booking by reading all the bookings of
    "the travel and incrementing the highest id by 1.
    "Also, the booking date is set to the current system date.
    DATA: lt_read_keys TYPE TABLE FOR READ IMPORT ZI_Travel_U_CSN\\Travel\_Booking,
          ls_read_key  LIKE LINE OF lt_read_keys,
          ls_result    LIKE LINE OF result.
    DATA: lv_new_booking_id TYPE /dmo/booking_id.

    LOOP AT keys INTO DATA(ls_key).
      ls_read_key-%tky = ls_key-%tky.   "%TKY includes %is_draft, %pid and TravelId
      INSERT ls_read_key INTO TABLE lt_read_keys.
    ENDLOOP.

    READ ENTITIES OF ZI_Travel_U_CSN IN LOCAL MODE
        ENTITY Travel BY \_Booking
           FIELDS ( TravelID BookingId )
           WITH lt_read_keys
           RESULT DATA(lt_bookings).

    SORT lt_bookings BY %is_draft %pidparent TravelId BookingId DESCENDING.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM lt_bookings COMPARING %is_draft %pidparent TravelId.

    LOOP AT keys INTO ls_key.
      CLEAR: ls_result, lv_new_booking_id.
      TRY.
          DATA(ls_booking) = lt_bookings[ KEY entity %is_draft = ls_key-%is_draft %pidparent = ls_key-%pid TravelId = ls_key-TravelID ].
          lv_new_booking_id = ls_booking-BookingID + 1.
        CATCH cx_root.
          lv_new_booking_id = 1.
      ENDTRY.
      ls_result-%tky = ls_key-%tky.
      ls_result-%param-TravelID    = ls_key-TravelID.
      ls_result-%param-BookingID   = lv_new_booking_id.
      ls_result-%param-BookingDate = cl_abap_context_info=>get_system_date( ).
      INSERT ls_result INTO TABLE result.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

As you can see, in method GetDefaultsForBookings we retrieve the current Bookings that are defined for a Travel, and include in RESULT attribute the next booking id and the system date as default values for the new entity that will be created. The relevant point to signal out is that, as we have Late Numbering for travel, %TKY has a new component (%PID) that will include the preliminary Id (draftuuid) when creating a new entity. Hence, all the EML operations should take into account this component when retrieving/updating values.

Saver Class LSC_ZI_TRAVEL_U_CSN

This class is responsible for the save logic of our Business Object. As we are going to call the API functions for CRUD operations in methods that as default are not supposed to raise errors (ADJUST_NUMBERS and SAVE_MODIFIED, explained later), we have to change the default superclass (CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_SAVER) with CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_SAVER_FAILED, that includes changing parameters for failed keys and response messages for these methods.

The general logic is then:

  • In ADJUST_NUMBERS the API function for the Travel CREATE will be called (optionally including its bookings), as the returned Travel Id has to be mapped in this method with the premilinary id.
  • In SAVE_MODIFIED method it is included the UPDATE/DELETE API Calls.

It has to be noted that SAVE_MODIFIED will be also called during the CREATE operation after the ADJUST_NUMBERS. Hence, we have to take care of not executing any logic in this case, as the CREATE API function has already been executed in ADJUST_NUMBERS. 

With this, the definition of the class is as follows (there are some axiliary types and methods defined that will be explained later):

CLASS lsc_ZI_TRAVEL_U_CSN DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_saver_failed.
  PROTECTED SECTION.
    TYPES: BEGIN OF ts_key,
             travelid      TYPE /dmo/travel_id,
             delete_entity TYPE abap_boolean,
           END OF ts_key,
           tt_keys TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ts_key WITH DEFAULT KEY.

    METHODS adjust_numbers REDEFINITION.

    METHODS save_modified REDEFINITION.

    METHODS cleanup_finalize REDEFINITION.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    TYPES: ts_read_result_travel  TYPE STRUCTURE FOR READ RESULT zi_travel_u_csn,
           ts_read_result_booking TYPE TABLE FOR READ RESULT zi_booking_u_csn,
           ts_failed              TYPE RESPONSE FOR FAILED LATE zi_travel_u_csn,
           ts_reported            TYPE RESPONSE FOR REPORTED LATE zi_travel_u_csn,
           ts_mapped              TYPE RESPONSE FOR MAPPED LATE zi_travel_u_csn,
           ts_request_change      TYPE REQUEST FOR CHANGE zi_travel_u_csn,
           ts_request_delete      TYPE REQUEST FOR DELETE zi_travel_u_csn.

    METHODS _add_deleted_bookings
      IMPORTING
        is_key      TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
        delete      TYPE ts_request_delete
      CHANGING
        ct_booking  TYPE /dmo/t_booking_in
        ct_bookingx TYPE /dmo/t_booking_inx.

    METHODS _add_updated_bookings
      IMPORTING
        is_key      TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
        update      TYPE ts_request_change
      CHANGING
        ct_booking  TYPE /dmo/t_booking_in
        ct_bookingx TYPE /dmo/t_booking_inx.

    METHODS _add_new_bookings
      IMPORTING
        is_key      TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
        create      TYPE ts_request_change
      CHANGING
        ct_booking  TYPE /dmo/t_booking_in
        ct_bookingx TYPE /dmo/t_booking_inx.

    METHODS _process_key
      IMPORTING
        is_key   TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
        create   TYPE ts_request_change
        update   TYPE ts_request_change
        delete   TYPE ts_request_delete
      CHANGING
        failed   TYPE ts_failed
        reported TYPE ts_reported.

    METHODS _delete_travel
      IMPORTING
        is_key      TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
      EXPORTING
        et_messages TYPE /dmo/t_message.

    METHODS _update_travel
      IMPORTING
        is_key      TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>ts_key
        create      TYPE ts_request_change
        update      TYPE ts_request_change
        delete      TYPE ts_request_delete
      EXPORTING
        et_messages TYPE /dmo/t_message.

    METHODS _get_processed_root_keys
      IMPORTING
        create          TYPE ts_request_change
        update          TYPE ts_request_change
        delete          TYPE ts_request_delete
      RETURNING
        VALUE(r_result) TYPE lsc_zi_travel_u_csn=>tt_keys.

    METHODS _create_travel
      IMPORTING
        is_travel    TYPE ts_read_result_travel
        it_bookings  TYPE ts_read_result_booking
      EXPORTING
        ev_travel_id TYPE /dmo/travel_id
      CHANGING
        failed       TYPE ts_failed
        reported     TYPE ts_reported
        mapped       TYPE ts_mapped.
ENDCLASS.

Now, we will review the relevant methods that we have to implement.

Method ADJUST_NUMBERS

The signature of this method is as follows:

As you can see, it includes FAILED and REPORTED parameters as is a subclass of cl_abap_behavior_saver_failed class. It has also a MAPPED parameter to include the mapping between the preliminary ID (%PID) and the final Id of the new objects. This MAPPED structure contains two tables, one for the Travel and another for the Bookings. 

In these tables, each record contains the premilinary id (%PID) of the new entity, the final id of each entity (component group %KEY) and an structure (%TMP) with the temporary key values that already have these entities in the interaction buffer. The objective of this method is to call the CREATE API function and populate %KEY structure with the corresponding Ids. For example, when creating a Travel with a Booking, MAPPED structure enters the method with this values (notice that BOOKING[1] - %TMP contains manually assigned Booking Id 1):

And after the successful creation of the new travel with the booking, the updated values are as follows:

Take into account that when creating a new booking for a existing travel, as the booking id is assigned during interaction phase, although no API call is done in this method, BOOKINGIDs have to be included in MAPPED structure by copying %TMP - BOOKINGID value. 

Given this, the source code of methods ADJUST_NUMBERS and _CREATE_TRAVEL is then:

  METHOD adjust_numbers.
    "Create processing logic to adjust numbers if needed
    "Read travel and booking data from buffer, call the API function and
    "create travel

    "Two create options:
    "1.- Create a new travel (with bookings)
    "2.- Crate a new booking for a existing travel

    DATA: lt_travel_key TYPE TABLE FOR READ IMPORT ZI_Travel_U_CSN\\Travel.
    DATA: lt_booking_key TYPE TABLE FOR READ IMPORT ZI_Travel_U_CSN\\Booking.

    "Process only if there are changes
    CHECK mapped-travel IS NOT INITIAL OR mapped-booking IS NOT INITIAL.

    "Read operation is done with %PID, %TMP-TRAVELID (this is initial for new travels)
    LOOP AT mapped-travel INTO DATA(ls_mapped_travel).
      INSERT VALUE #( %pid = ls_mapped_travel-%pid %key = ls_mapped_travel-%tmp ) INTO TABLE lt_travel_key.
    ENDLOOP.
    "Read operation is done with %PID, %TMP-TRAVELID, %TMP-BOOKINGID
    LOOP AT mapped-booking INTO DATA(ls_mapped_booking).
      INSERT VALUE #( %pid = ls_mapped_booking-%pid %key = ls_mapped_booking-%tmp ) INTO TABLE lt_booking_key.
    ENDLOOP.

    READ ENTITIES OF ZI_Travel_U_CSN IN LOCAL MODE
        ENTITY Travel
           ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( lt_travel_key )
           RESULT DATA(lt_all_travels).

    READ ENTITIES OF ZI_Travel_U_CSN IN LOCAL MODE
        ENTITY Booking
           ALL FIELDS WITH CORRESPONDING #( lt_booking_key )
           RESULT DATA(lt_all_bookings).

    "Create travel with bookings (case 1)
    LOOP AT lt_all_travels INTO DATA(ls_travel).
      DATA(lt_bookings) = lt_all_bookings.
      DELETE lt_bookings WHERE %pidparent <> ls_travel-%pid.
      _create_travel(
        EXPORTING
          is_travel      = ls_travel
          it_bookings    = lt_bookings
        IMPORTING
          ev_travel_id   = ls_travel-TravelID
        CHANGING
          failed         = failed
          reported       = reported
          mapped         = mapped
      ).

    ENDLOOP.

    "Assign pending booking id from preliminary identifiers. Take into account that this values
    "are assigned during interaction phase
    "At this point, we will assign new bookings ids for existing travels (case 2)
    LOOP AT mapped-booking ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_booking>)
    WHERE bookingid IS INITIAL AND
          %tmp-TravelID IS NOT INITIAL AND
          %tmp-BookingID IS NOT INITIAL.
      <fs_booking>-TravelID  = <fs_booking>-%tmp-TravelID.
      <fs_booking>-Bookingid = <fs_booking>-%tmp-Bookingid.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD _create_travel.

    "Call /DMO/FLIGHT_TRABEL_CREATE function to create travel and bookings
    "Take into account that this API requires two calls: 1 for create and 1 for save (persist data in database)

    DATA: ls_travel_out  TYPE /dmo/travel,
          ls_travel_in   TYPE /dmo/s_travel_in,
          ls_booking_in  TYPE /dmo/s_booking_in,
          lt_bookings_in TYPE /dmo/t_booking_in,
          lt_messages    TYPE /dmo/t_message.

    "Initialize buffers
    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_INITIALIZE'.

    ls_travel_in = CORRESPONDING #( is_travel MAPPING FROM ENTITY ).
    LOOP AT it_bookings INTO DATA(ls_booking).
      CLEAR: ls_booking_in.
      ls_booking_in = CORRESPONDING #( ls_booking MAPPING FROM ENTITY ).
      INSERT ls_booking_in INTO TABLE lt_bookings_in.
    ENDLOOP.

    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_CREATE'
      EXPORTING
        is_travel   = ls_travel_in
        it_booking  = lt_bookings_in
      IMPORTING
        es_travel   = ls_travel_out
        et_messages = lt_messages.

    "Map errors as failed
    DELETE lt_messages WHERE msgty NA 'EAX'.

    IF lt_messages[] IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT lt_messages INTO DATA(ls_message).
        INSERT VALUE #( %tky = is_travel-%tky
                        %msg = new_message( id       = ls_message-msgid
                                            severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                            number   = ls_message-msgno
                                            v1       = ls_message-msgv1
                                            v2       = ls_message-msgv2
                                            v3       = ls_message-msgv3
                                            v4       = ls_message-msgv4 )
                        ) INTO TABLE reported-travel.
      ENDLOOP.
      INSERT VALUE #( %tky = is_travel-%tky ) INTO TABLE failed-travel.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    "Save to database
    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_SAVE'.

    "Map final ids
    "Travel
    READ TABLE mapped-travel ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_mapped_travel>)
      WITH KEY id COMPONENTS %pid = is_travel-%pid.
    <fs_mapped_travel>-TravelID = ls_travel_out-travel_id.

    "Bookings for this travel
    LOOP AT it_bookings ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_booking>)
      WHERE %pidparent = is_travel-%pid.
      "Map booking id
      READ TABLE mapped-booking ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_mapped_booking>)
        WITH KEY id COMPONENTS %pid = <fs_booking>-%pid.
      <fs_mapped_booking>-BookingId = <fs_booking>-BookingId.
      <fs_mapped_booking>-TravelID  = ls_travel_out-travel_id.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

Method SAVE_MODIFIED

This method is called by the runtime once all the preliminary ids have been mapped to the final ids in ADJUST_NUMBERS method. Hence, this is the point where we have to implement the calls to the UPDATE / DELETE APIs. As was stated previously, we have to exclude the Travel CREATE operation (as it has been processed in ADJUST_NUMBERS method), although we have to process the Booking CREATE records for a exisiting Travel, as this corresponds to an UPDATE API call of a Travel.

The interface of this methods is as follows (again, notice the FAILED and REPORTED parameters included as this class is a subclass of cl_abap_behavior_saver_failed).

CREATE, UPDATE and DELETE structures contains each one TRAVEL and BOOKING tables with the relevant entities that are being saved.

The general logic that has been implemented is:

  • First, all the relevant travel ids that are being processed are grouped in internal table LT_PROCESSED_KEYS (method _GET_PROCESSED_ROOT_KEYS), discarding new created travels.
  • For each key, method _PROCESS_KEY is called, where etither method _DETELE_TRAVEL (when the operation corresponds to a deletion) or _UPDATE_TRAVEL are executed. Within each method, the corresponding API functions are called. If there are any reported errors, FAILED and REPORTED structures are updated accordingly.
  • There are some auxiliary methods defined (_ADD_DELETED_BOOKINGS, _ADD_NEW_BOOKINGS, _ADD_UPDATED_BOOKINGS) to populate UPDATE API importing parameters for modified bookings.

The source code of the relevant methods is then:

  METHOD save_modified.
    "Update processing logic to save modified data
    "Process only updated travels. Created travels are processed in adjust_numbers method

    DATA: lt_processed_keys TYPE tt_keys.

    lt_processed_keys = _get_processed_root_keys( create = create
                                                  update = update
                                                  delete = delete ).

    LOOP AT lt_processed_keys INTO DATA(ls_key).
      _process_key( EXPORTING is_key = ls_key
                               create = create
                               update = update
                               delete = delete
                     CHANGING  failed   = failed
                               reported = reported ).
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD _get_processed_root_keys.

    LOOP AT create-booking INTO DATA(ls_booking).
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = ls_booking-TravelID ) INTO TABLE r_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT update-booking INTO ls_booking.
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = ls_booking-TravelID ) INTO TABLE r_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT update-travel INTO DATA(ls_travel).
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = ls_travel-TravelID ) INTO TABLE r_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT delete-travel INTO DATA(ls_delete_travel).
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = ls_delete_travel-TravelID delete_entity = abap_true ) INTO TABLE r_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    LOOP AT delete-booking INTO DATA(ls_delete_booking).
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = ls_delete_booking-TravelID ) INTO TABLE r_result.
    ENDLOOP.

    "Discard created travels as they are processed in adjust_numbers method
    LOOP AT create-travel INTO ls_travel.
      DELETE r_result WHERE travelid = ls_travel-TravelID.
    ENDLOOP.

    SORT r_result BY travelid delete_entity DESCENDING.
    DELETE ADJACENT DUPLICATES FROM r_result COMPARING travelid.


  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _update_travel.


    DATA: ls_travel   TYPE /dmo/s_travel_in,
          ls_travelx  TYPE /dmo/s_travel_inx,
          lt_booking  TYPE /dmo/t_booking_in,
          lt_bookingx TYPE /dmo/t_booking_inx.

    "Updated value for travel?
    TRY.
        DATA(ls_update_travel) = update-travel[ KEY id TravelID = is_key-travelid ].
        ls_travel = CORRESPONDING #( ls_update_travel MAPPING FROM ENTITY ).
        ls_travelx = CORRESPONDING #(  CORRESPONDING /dmo/s_travel_intx( ls_update_travel MAPPING FROM ENTITY USING CONTROL ) ).
      CATCH cx_root.
    ENDTRY.
    ls_travel-travel_id = is_key-travelid.
    ls_travelx-travel_id = is_key-travelid.
    "Bookings created
    _add_new_bookings( EXPORTING is_key = is_key
                                 create = create
                      CHANGING
                        ct_booking = lt_booking
                        ct_bookingx = lt_bookingx ).

    "Bookings updated
    _add_updated_bookings( EXPORTING is_key = is_key
                                 update = update
                      CHANGING
                        ct_booking = lt_booking
                        ct_bookingx = lt_bookingx ).


    "Bookings deleted
    _add_deleted_bookings( EXPORTING is_key = is_key
                                 delete = delete
                      CHANGING
                        ct_booking = lt_booking
                        ct_bookingx = lt_bookingx ).

    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_UPDATE'
      EXPORTING
        is_travel   = ls_travel
        is_travelx  = ls_travelx
        it_booking  = lt_booking
        it_bookingx = lt_bookingx
      IMPORTING
        et_messages = et_messages.

  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _delete_travel.

    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_DELETE'
      EXPORTING
        iv_travel_id = is_key-travelid
      IMPORTING
        et_messages  = et_messages.

  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _process_key.

    DATA: lt_messages TYPE /dmo/t_message.

    "Initialize buffers
    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_INITIALIZE'.

    IF is_key-delete_entity = abap_true.
      _delete_travel( EXPORTING is_key = is_key
                          IMPORTING et_messages = lt_messages ).
    ELSE.
      _update_travel( EXPORTING is_key = is_key
                                    create = create
                                    update = update
                                    delete = delete
                          IMPORTING et_messages = lt_messages ).
    ENDIF.

    DELETE lt_messages WHERE msgty NA 'EAX'.
    IF lt_messages[] IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT lt_messages INTO DATA(ls_message).
        INSERT VALUE #( travelid = is_key-travelid
                        %msg = new_message( id       = ls_message-msgid
                                            severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                            number   = ls_message-msgno
                                            v1       = ls_message-msgv1
                                            v2       = ls_message-msgv2
                                            v3       = ls_message-msgv3
                                            v4       = ls_message-msgv4 )
                        ) INTO TABLE reported-travel.
      ENDLOOP.
      INSERT VALUE #( travelid = is_key-travelid ) INTO TABLE failed-travel.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    "Save to database
    CALL FUNCTION '/DMO/FLIGHT_TRAVEL_SAVE'.



  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _add_new_bookings.

    DATA: ls_booking_in  TYPE /dmo/s_booking_in,
          ls_booking_inx TYPE /dmo/s_booking_inx.

    LOOP AT create-booking INTO DATA(ls_booking)
        USING KEY id WHERE TravelID = is_key-travelid.
      "Add new booking
      CLEAR: ls_booking_in, ls_booking_inx.

      ls_booking_in  = CORRESPONDING #( ls_booking MAPPING FROM ENTITY ).
      ls_booking_inx = CORRESPONDING #( CORRESPONDING /dmo/s_booking_intx( ls_booking MAPPING FROM ENTITY USING CONTROL ) ).
      ls_booking_inx-action_code = 'C'.
      ls_booking_inx-booking_id  = ls_booking_in-booking_id.
      INSERT ls_booking_in INTO TABLE ct_booking.
      INSERT ls_booking_inx INTO TABLE ct_bookingx.
    ENDLOOP.


  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _add_updated_bookings.

    DATA: ls_booking_in  TYPE /dmo/s_booking_in,
          ls_booking_inx TYPE /dmo/s_booking_inx.

    LOOP AT update-booking INTO DATA(ls_booking)
        USING KEY id WHERE TravelID = is_key-travelid.
      "Add updated booking
      CLEAR: ls_booking_in, ls_booking_inx.

      ls_booking_in  = CORRESPONDING #( ls_booking MAPPING FROM ENTITY ).
      ls_booking_inx = CORRESPONDING #( CORRESPONDING /dmo/s_booking_intx( ls_booking MAPPING FROM ENTITY USING CONTROL ) ).
      ls_booking_inx-action_code = 'U'.
      ls_booking_inx-booking_id  = ls_booking_in-booking_id.
      INSERT ls_booking_in INTO TABLE ct_booking.
      INSERT ls_booking_inx INTO TABLE ct_bookingx.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD _add_deleted_bookings.

    DATA: ls_booking_in  TYPE /dmo/s_booking_in,
          ls_booking_inx TYPE /dmo/s_booking_inx.

    LOOP AT delete-booking INTO DATA(ls_booking)
        USING KEY entity WHERE TravelID = is_key-travelid.
      "add delete booking
      CLEAR: ls_booking_inx, ls_booking_in.
      ls_booking_in-travel_id = is_key-travelid.
      ls_booking_in-booking_id = ls_booking-BookingId.
      INSERT ls_booking_in INTO TABLE ct_booking.
      ls_booking_inx-action_code = 'D'.
      ls_booking_inx-booking_id  = ls_booking-BookingId.
      INSERT ls_booking_inx INTO TABLE ct_bookingx.
    ENDLOOP.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

Conclussions

I hope that this blog has clarified how to develop a RAP UI to execute CRUD operation in an entity that has a legacy API to maintain it. I think that this can be more or less easily adapted to other APIs.

entry.title: Re: F110 payment run PRINTOUT program not showing all pay...
entry.content:
Hello @Vasutm 

Thank you for your question.

Following up on the reported issue with the F110 payment run, where not all payment medium files (for payment methods D, K, and O) are generated together after pressing Printout, please find below the detailed analysis and recommendations.

Here is the observed Behaviour

  • Payment methods D, K, and O are correctly configured in DMEE and Payment Medium Workbench.
  • After executing F110 and triggering Printout, only two output files are generated in AL11.
  • Re-running the proposal/printout produces different combinations for example D+K, then D+O, then K+O, but never all three together in one execution.

Here is the potential root cause

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the payment medium generation step is executed sequentially and controlled by the Payment Medium Workbench.

  • When multiple payment methods are bundled in a single F110 run, the system may skip one of the methods during printout execution.
  • This is typically caused by:
    • Grouping logic in PMW, which can merge or suppress output files.
    • Job execution sequence in F110, where the payment medium program terminates after processing two formats, leaving the third unprocessed.
  • Each subsequent re-run picks up the remaining items, which is why you see alternating outputs.

Below are my recommended actions

  1. Review Payment Medium Workbench Settings (SSCUI 100297 – Configure Automatic Payment Transactions)
    • Confirm that each payment method is linked to a unique Payment Medium Format.
    • Ensure that the “Always create file” is enabled for each payment method, so files are generated even if the system groups payments.
  2. Check F110 Payment Logs
    • In F110 –> Environment –> Payment Medium –> Payment Medium Overview, review the job log to confirm whether a skipped payment method is logged as “no items” or “already generated”.
  3. Run F110 Separately per Payment Method
    • To ensure consistent output in Public Cloud, SAP recommends executing F110 separately for each payment method.
    • This guarantees one clean output file per method without dependency on grouping logic.

Automatic Payment Program - Transaction F110 overview

Configuring Payment Medium Formats

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
The open nature of SAP Datasphere's architecture is very much like Sergio Leone's epic spaghetti Western film, "The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" for no reason other than how some designs can be described as such.

One of Datasphere’s biggest strength is the flexibility in how quickly a new solution can be built. It is delightfully fast. From the initial replication of SAP tables to a consumption-ready Analytical model, the development time is a fraction of prior efforts. Unfortunately, this same speed when unsupervised can lead to an excessive number of objects that will clutter and ironically slow down development.

Issues with Runaway Spaces

  • Production models using Development data
  • Transports of objects between spaces break
  • Navigation and development become a chore

If you're considering SAP Datasphere as a BW replacement or if you're already kicking the tires with a pilot project, this will help (and save you months of rework).

After implementing SAP Datasphere for a couple of clients, I've encountered limitations of the common, initial setup (The Bad) and worked through the growing pains of architecture the landscape to a scalable design that accommodates multiple teams and lines of business (The Good).

The First Design – Our Initial Approach

  • 1-tenant
  • 1-space per environment

An initial design may look like this, which isn't all that bad (but there is a better approach that I will explain later).

It is simple concept to understand. The development objects are drafted in a Development space (DEV). The refined objects are imported and tested in a Quality Assurance space (QA). The approved objects are reviewed and imported into a Production space (PRD).

This approach isolates the objects based on their maturity along the development, testing, and approval process. It also helps the technical team as they explore SAP Datasphere concepts, such as graphical versus SQL views, relational vs. fact, dataflow vs replication flow, and so forth. It's a good start.

 

The First Issues

We started running into trouble, however, during promotion or "transports" of objects.

Because each space was a different database schema, we had to take care when exporting the CSN file that contained our object definition, which required manually editing the database prefix via a text editor before importing it into the next space.

We had edit access to the three spaces, so sometimes we find an object in the Quality Assurance or Production space may be referring an object from the Development space.

This issue was compounded as our team grew and required additional coordination.

  • How can we ensure business analysts do not change IT-developed objects?
  • How do we define security so that only the approved personnel can view sensitive information?
  • Is everyone following the same approach for development, testing (quality assurance), and production?

Our SAP Datasphere architecture had to adapt and service the growing IT team and the addition of new business groups. The number of mistakes increased as the teams grew. We had to find another way.

 

The Revision

The Second Design – Our Revision

  • 2-tenants (PRD and DEV/QA)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space

Our second design of the Datasphere architecture separated the initial, inbound tables into its own space.

This allowed use to refine the role of the modelers, separating the ones who were developing the master data dimensions and relational datasets apart from those who had additional access to maintain system connections and monitor data flows and tasks chains. This was an IT-centric approach because we were on boarding more data engineers to help with the workload while defining roles and responsibilities.

With the second SAP Datasphere tenant, the transport process was smoother since we no longer had to manually edit CSN files. Also, the concern about mixing Production and Development objects were gone because the objects were in different tenants.

I imagine most teams stop here and this approach works well for IT-centric organizations where the data engineers are responsible for most of the data modeling. This approach also allows the larger group of data engineers to focus on building the data models while a smaller group maintain and coordinate the data loads as not overwhelm the environment.

 

The Final Architecture

The Third Design – Our Current Architecture

  • 3-tenants (PRD, QA, and DEV)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 admin-space
  • n business-space

Our third design of the SAP Datasphere architecture grew out of the initial success of our reporting and data project.

The business teams were excited with their new dashboards and the speed in which our team were able to deliver new models. The demand from our business community exceeded our team's ability to deliver due to the volume of the requests. Around this time, there was a concern about data sensitivity especially around the company financial information.

The admin-space allowed use to define row-level security via Data Access Controls (DAC). Once defined, these objects can be shared to the modeling-space. Very few people on the team were granted access to maintain objects in the admin-space.

The modeling-space remains largely the same. The data engineers continued to build their initial propagation views and fact views, maintaining the relationships and semantic enrichment. What changed was the omission of analytical models.

When ready, the fact views were shared to the business-specific spaces. This allowed the business analysis to further refine the models for their specific needs, such as adding custom restrictive measures, calculations, or aggregations.

This 3-layered approach (inbound, modeling, and reporting) allowed the data engineers who are familiar with the source SAP table relationships to build a strong foundation in the modeling-space while allowing the business analysis to consume and tailor the output.

 

Next Time

If I were to build another SAP Datasphere tenant from the ground-up, I would keep the spaces to a minimum but allow the tenant to expand with the growing pains (of rearchitecting). In essence, it would be a slimmed version of the third design.

The Space Template

  • 2-tenant (minimum), 3-tenant (recommended)
  • 1 inbound-space
  • 1 modeling-space
  • 1 reporting-space

Now that SAP Datasphere (formerly Data Warehouse Cloud and recently packaged under SAP Business Data Cloud) has been released and used by customers for a several years now, I’m curious to hear how it’s been deployed. How are you organizing the Spaces (by domain, team, or lifecycle)? Who owns the metric definitions across Spaces? How do you package the Datasphere models so that the SAC teams can consume them easily?

entry.title: Tree-Table Support in CAP is Now Generally Available
entry.content:
Since July, the Tree-Table Support in the SAP Cloud Programming Model (CAP) is generally available. This exciting milestone represents the culmination of months of dedicated work. Our journey began in February with the initial release of Hierarchy Maintenance in the Tree Table for Java, followed in March by Recursive Hierarchies and Fiori Tree Table support for Node.js in beta. Since then, we’ve consistently rolled out new features in beta, leading up to July 2025 when we officially announced that CAP's tree view support has exited beta and is now generally available.

Key Features

  • Hierarchical Entities Definition: Use standard OData/Fiori annotations to define hierarchical entities.
  • Hierarchical Queries: Hierarchical queries from the underlying SAPUI5 Tree Table components are generically served by CAP runtimes.
  • Read-Only Usage: Hierarchical entities can be used in read-only mode in List Views and Value Helps, including expanding/collapsing of an entire tree or separate nodes as well as sort, filter, and search functionalities on hierarchical data.

  • Modification Capabilities for draft enabled entities:
    • Node Operations: Create new nodes, add them as root or child nodes, modify and delete nodes, and change a parent of a child node (node movement).

    • Hierarchy Management: Deleting a node will cascade the deletion to its descendant nodes if they are in a composition relationship with the deleted node.
    • Object Page Support: The same set of modifications is supported on the Object Page, with the main difference, that all nodes on the List View have their own drafts, but all nodes on the Object Page belong to the same draft.
  • Database Support:
    • For Java we already support SAP HANA and H2, with PostgreSQL to follow.
    • For Node.js we support SAP HANA, SQLite, and PostgreSQL.

Current Limitations

We want to keep you informed about what’s not (yet) supported so you can plan accordingly:

  • Interception and modification of hierarchical queries in custom handlers
  • Arbitrary OData query options other than the ones served today for SAPUI5 Tree Table

Get Started

  • Demo: Check out our demo session recording from reCAP 2025: TreeTables Support in CAP.
  • Try it out: Explore the new features in our bookshop sample apps for CAP Java and CAP Node.js.

The general availability of Tree-Table Support in CAP opens up a wealth of opportunities to streamline hierarchical data management. We encourage you to dive in, explore the capabilities, and share your experiences with the community.

Happy coding!

entry.title: How to create a namespace in SAP BTP Credential store via API
entry.content:
I am trying to create a namespace via api but I am getting 403 error, is it possible to do? I was able to create passwords and access it but am unable to create a namespace. I have added the code I am using

async function createNamespace(vcapServices, namespaceName) {
    if (!vcapServices || !vcapServices['credstore']) {
        throw new Error('VCAP_SERVICES environment variable not found or credstore service not bound');
    }

    const binding = vcapServices['credstore'][0]['credentials'];
    
    const url = `${binding.url}/namespaces`;
    const auth = Buffer.from(`${binding.username}:${binding.password}`).toString('base64');
    
    // Prepare server public key for encryption
    const serverPublicKeyPem = `-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\n${binding.encryption.server_public_key}\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----`;
    const serverPublicKey = await jose.JWK.asKey(serverPublicKeyPem, 'pem');
    
    // Prepare payload for encryption
    const payload = JSON.stringify({
        name: namespaceName
    });
    
    try {
        // Get current timestamp for 'iat' header
        const issuedAt = Math.floor(Date.now() / 1000);
        
        // Encrypt the payload using JWE with required 'iat' header
        const encryptedPayload = await jose.JWE.createEncrypt({
            format: 'compact',
            contentAlg: 'A256GCM',
            fields: { 
                alg: 'RSA-OAEP-256',
                iat: issuedAt
            }
        }, serverPublicKey)
        .update(payload)
        .final();
        
        const headers = {
            'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}`,
            'Content-Type': 'application/jose'
        };

        const response = await fetch(url, {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: headers,
            body: encryptedPayload
        });

        if (!response.ok) {
            const errorText = await response.text();
            throw new Error(`HTTP error! status: ${response.status}, message: ${errorText}`);
        }

        console.log(`Namespace '${namespaceName}' created successfully`);
    } catch (error) {
        throw new Error(`Error creating namespace '${namespaceName}': ${error.message}`);
    }
}

entry.title: Public Sector highlights of the SAP Cloud ERP 2508 release
entry.content:
As planned, the Public Sector Management (PSM) Global scope bundle is now available for over 20 countries, including France, Italy, Spain, Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Mexico, and Saudi Arabia.  With ever increasing demand, we continue the planned expansion to additional countries in 2602.  Check out the roadmap for details.  

Cloud ERP core enhancements

As always, there’s a range of new core Cloud ERP feature-based innovations for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition with the 2508 release. If you are interested in other areas of innovations for SAP’s Cloud ERP, please check out the Release Video from Bert Schulze:

 

 


Screenshot + URL: Get the top highlights of the 2508 release in this video by Bert Schulze

New AI Features for Public Sector

The AI-assisted easy filter in SAP Fiori elements-based applications allows users to define filter queries using natural language, making it easier to find specific entries without manually applying filters. Users can toggle between Classic mode and SAP Business AI-mode, view favorite and last used queries, and easily reset filters to display all entries. ​This feature has now been enabled within the SAP Fiori app, Manage Budget Documents, allowing budget users to use budget document attributes and natural language to easily find what they are looking for.​ AI-assisted filter criteria can be saved as a view and defined as a default view to help make it easier to find these same objects every time, including the ability to save a public or private view.​
​

​Try typing “not posted” and automatically filter on all document statuses except posted.

​

 

Typing ‘sender over 1k usd created in last fortnight’ will automatically filter on large budget transfers in the last 2 weeks.

In the SAP Fiori Launchpad, you can use the AI-assisted enterprise search to access public sector management objects like fund and grant. Depending on your business role, you see a list of business objects in the​ SAP Fiori Launchpad search dropdown. This feature allows you to use natural language for searching public sector management business data. You can enter your search queries in natural language in the SAP Fiori Launchpad search bar to find the information you need.​

Enable natural language search on business objects by selecting the checkbox ’Enable AI Natural Language Search’ from the user profile settings. ​ On selecting the checkbox, you can view the list of business objects that are configured for natural language search.

Try searching “show me funds created recently” and get a list of newly created funds.

   

    
PSM Global

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release delivers a robust suite of Grants and Budget Management features tailored for public sector entities, including state and local governments, non-profits, cities, K-12 schools, and education & research institutions.

Building upon previous releases, the 2508 update introduces new capabilities designed to support public sector customers. Read on for an overview of the latest advancements.

For more details on the global PSM scope bundle, visit the SAP Process Navigator to explore the complete list of available scope items.

Screenshot: Process Navigator focused on S/4HANA Public Cloud and the PSM industry capabilities.


Workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management

Manage Workflows for Earmarked Funds has been enhanced with enabling the workflows for earmarked funds from contract and lease management.

When a lease-in contract is created, earmarked funds are generated automatically, subject to approval settings. You can specify whether all changes, only initial changes, or no changes require approval. The workflow is managed through the "Manage Workflow for Earmarked Funds" step, where properties, conditions, and steps are defined. The default procedure from the Workflow for Earmarked Funds Document is used, ensuring that subsequent processing aligns with the initial setup. (source – Joule!)

​Overview

  • Enablement of workflow for earmarked funds from contract and lease management
  • Ability to determine approval procedure

Benefits

  • Enable effective budget control by providing the ability for the budget manager to approve or disapprove the commitment from contract and lease management
  • Improve efficiency by streamlining approval process
  • Boost collaboration and compliance

​  

Screenshot: workflow for earmarked funds with Contract and Lease Management.

 

Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Public Sector Management (PSM) now offers the Budget Consumption Review Booklet application to perform a detailed review of the PSM budget line items, commitment/actual lines items, and budget and commitment actual line items and other relevant details.

 * available 2508.1 release, with incremental feature releases over the next few months

Overview:

  • Combines the queries for the Budget Line Item Analyzer, the Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer, and the Budget and Commitment/Actual Line Item Analyzer
  • Includes pages for each of the 3 reports, viewing each by revenue, expense, or combined
  • Includes all the filters and key figures available in the earlier line item analyzer reports

Benefits:

  • Ability to enter and save comments at the field, page, or report level
  • AI Business Insights and Navigate To features planned for future incremental releases

Screenshot: Budget Consumption Review Booklet

Availability control (AVC) and budget address validations during the import of financial plan data

It is possible to either import PSM budget (via excel upload or via interface from SAC) or create budget documents. During these activities budget addresses and AVC control addresses are never allowed to be negative. Through the “Import Financial Plan Data” app or SAC interface, this new feature checks to avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC and to avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)​

Overview

During the budget upload through the “Import Financial Plan Data” app, new checks to:

  • Avoid budget overruns defined through the configuration of AVC
  • Avoid negative amounts on a complete budget address (combining of account assignments such as fund, budget account, grant, and budget type)
  • During budget upload and SAC imports the automatic validations are performed and will show possible overruns before the budget data is updated.

Benefits

  • Improve budget consistency (for example, avoiding unwanted negative budgets)
  • This functionality also avoids an accidental deletion of budget data in case the overwrite indicators are set incorrectly. It also avoids the possible deletion of budget documents with header information. ​

 

Screenshot: error message in upload log

 

Using statistical projects with public-sector management

You can automatically derive PSM account assignments from statistical WBS elements when the cost center does not have a fixed assignment. For example, if you set a fixed PSM account assignment on a statistical WBS element and do not set one on the cost center, the system uses the assignment from the statistical WBS element.  This feature allows for better management of budget for statistical projects.

Screenshot: PSM account assignments on a statistical project

 

Position budgeting with funds pre-commitments and budget availability check

  • Enable financing of positions with their corresponding funding sources, such as funds, grants, or functional areas, and monitoring and control of budget consumption
  • Create earmarked fund precommitments in SAP Cloud ERP to reserve the position budget
  • Finance vacant positions

Benefits

Enable accurate budget monitoring and control of personnel expenses by allowing the financing of positions in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Features

When a new employment gets created in SAP SuccessFactors, based on the employment costs, the necessary budget gets reserved in SAP Cloud ERP through an earmarked funds document of type commitment document. When an employee gets hired in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, based on the salary of the employee, the budget gets reserved in the SAP Cloud ERP system through an earmarked funds document, of type Commitment document. During every payroll run for the employee, the existing commitment document gets adjusted with the corresponding payroll actuals amount, and the corresponding actuals document is created and posted in the SAP Cloud ERP.

  • You can finance employees in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central by using Position Budgeting Control for Cloud. The financing uses information from the funds commitment amount in SAP Cloud ERP.
  • Position Budgeting Control for Cloud allows you to ensure that employees are sufficiently budgeted for a specified financial period.

 

Picture: Position Budgeting Control – Financing Details.

 

Key Summary

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition latest 2508 release brings key enhancements, including AI-driven user experiences, embedded AI features, and improved Grants and Budget Management capabilities.  This release continues to drive efficiency, scalability, and sustainability in ERP operations for public sector organizations. Please join us in the Cloud ERP revolution and explore how these innovations can unlock your organization’s full potential.

Trial System

Want to try out S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, for public sector?   Get a closer look at budget and grants management scenarios?   Access the public trial system.  Register for a free, two-week trial and take it for a spin.   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, public sector Trial

📽️ Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand–anywhere, anytime.

entry.title: Re: 委外采购订单能否将销售订单库存E 发到委外库存中
entry.content:
您好！感谢提问。如您提供的图中显示外协PO的组件可以是E stock+L的组合，但特殊库存状态只能一种（特殊库存标识字段single value），要么是E，要么是分包库存O，E stock和O库存不能同时存在，也就是没法直接将E stock转到分包O库存仍然保持E stock状态。当外协组件启用E stock+L组合时，不需要做541的库存转出动作，E stock直接在543收货的时候进行扣减。

参考标准文档解释：Subcontracting is also possible in conjunction with sales order stocks and project stocks. The subcontracting orders are account-assigned to a sales order or a WBS element. Thus, the components are not transferred (using a transfer posting) to the "stock of material provided to vendor" but are directly withdrawn from the sales order stock or the project stock at the time of the goods receipt. The material manufactured is also posted to the sales order stock or to the project stock. The cost of subcontracting is then debited to the sales order or WBS element. Since the components are not transferred to the "stock of material provided to vendor", we recommend that you use a transfer posting to transfer the provided components to a new storage location (for example, 9999). This enables you to obtain an overview of those stocks that are physically located at the subcontractor. This information is particularly important when you carry out a physical inventory of the sales order stocks and project stocks.

以上信息供参考，推荐系统中结合测试，以测试结果为准。

谢谢。

entry.title: Re: Issue in processing multiple PO in behavior class usi...
entry.content:
Hello @Renuga 

You are seeing this because EML functions within RAP's behaviour logic.:

  • When you modify another BO (here: I_PurchaseOrderTP_2) from a behaviour class, your EML must run IN LOCAL MODE so the changes are buffered in the same save sequence as your outer BO
  • If you fire several MODIFY ENTITIES calls without IN LOCAL MODE, only the last call is recorded in the interaction buffer; earlier ones do not make it to the final save.
  • Also ensure each generated child row has a unique %cid (per request)

Use this alternative (single shot, local mode, unique CIDs)

DATA lt_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE

  I_PurchaseOrderTP_2\purchaseorderitem\_PurOrdPricingElement.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO1'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO1_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '1'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO2'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO2_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '2'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 **IN LOCAL MODE**

  ENTITY PurchaseOrderItem

    CREATE BY \_PurOrdPricingElement

      SET FIELDS WITH lt_create

  MAPPED   DATA(mapped)

  FAILED   DATA(failed)

  REPORTED DATA(reported).

 

" Optional: check failures

IF line_exists( failed-purchaseorderitem[  ] ).

  " handle/log messages from 'reported'

ENDIF.

 

If you prefer separate calls

You can still issue the MODIFY ENTITIES command twice, but make sure to add IN LOCAL MODE to each call and use different %cids.

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

Extra checks

  • Ensure the PO items exist and aren’t locked by another LUW.
  • Avoid using COMMIT WORK within behaviour classes—the framework commits after SAVE is triggered.
  • Inspect FAILED/REPORTED after the first call; if it’s not in local mode, you’ll usually see no hard error, just the earlier changes being overwritten by the next interaction.

Below are some helpful SAP Documentation

  1. SAP Help – Entity Manipulation Language (EML): explains IN LOCAL MODE and how it affects buffering and checks in the save sequence. SAP Help Portal-Entity Manipulation Language (EML)
  2. ABAP Keyword Doc – MODIFY ENTITY/ENTITIES: full syntax and usage for RAP MODIFY with CREATE BY/associations. SAP Help Portal-MODIFY ENTITY, ENTITIES-ABAP Keyword Documentation

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: ‌🇨🇳‌ 2025 CSUA Annual Conference
entry.content:
The China SAP User Association (CSUA) invites SAP professionals, enterprise leaders, and technology experts to its 2025 Annual Membership Conference and 13th Anniversary Celebration!

This year’s theme, Suite-Driven Business, AI-Empowered Future, reflects the evolving intersection of enterprise digitalization and artificial intelligence.

The morning agenda features a series of focused sessions covering both business and technical topics. Key areas include:

  • SAP Business Suite and Business AI
  • Generative large model applications
  • Data asset management and analytical reporting, et al. 

The afternoon will spotlight the prestigious 2025 CSUA Golden Dragon Awards. Award-winning enterprises will present their Golden Dragon Annual Aotian projects, showcasing leadership in digital transformation.

Additionally, CSUA will officially release a series of group standards developed in collaboration with member enterprises.

This conference is targeted at members of CSUA and SAP user organizations (limited seats).

Check out the agenda and register here. 

If you want to learn about the localization topics in China provided by SAP experts, join the Greater China - Human Capital Management Localization WorkZone group.

entry.title: Manually Adding Employees to Compensation (Duplicates)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

Are you aware of a way to control employee membership when manually adding employees to a compensation worksheet? What we’re trying to achieve is a standard validation that checks whether an employee is already part of the cycle and prevents the Admin from adding them again manually.

Currently, the system is generating worksheets with all eligible employees as expected. However, the Admin is still able to manually add employees afterward, and the system is allowing duplicates to be added. It would be really helpful if the system could display a warning—similar to the one shown when an employee is not eligible for the cycle.

Note: The “Do not duplicate employees” setting is enabled, but as per SAP KBA 2084284, this does not apply to employees added manually by the Admin.

Do you have any insights or workarounds for this?

entry.title: Re: Not able to post data to OData V4 API in S4
entry.content:
Hi,

XML input used:

<Details> <DetailsType> <UUID>85a76f00-1920-4a6d-b67c-64a9f87248a0</UUID> <bname>HARTDT</bname> <auth_type>IN</auth_type> <gpid>RK89IO04</gpid> <waers>EUR</waers> <usdlimit>65000</usdlimit> <limit>1300.00</limit> <approver>BERGGJ</approver> <temp_delegation>X</temp_delegation> <_Limit> <bukrs>1000</bukrs> <usdlimit>400.00</usdlimit> <limit>400.00</limit> <UUID>85a76f00-1920-4a6d-b67c-64a9f87248a0</UUID> </_Limit> </DetailsType> </Details>

Error Details: com.sap.gw.core.ip.exception.ODataProcessingException: The XML is malformed

We are using Query Builder to generate the XSD for the POST request and using that as a reference to build the payload.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
<xs:element name="Details">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="DetailsType">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element type="xs:string" nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="UUID" xmlns=""/>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="bname">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="40"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="auth_type">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="2"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="gpid">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="40"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="waers">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="5"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="usdlimit">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="13"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="limit">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="20"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>

entry.title: Disable VizFrame default popover on data selection
entry.content:
I recently faced an issue while working with a VizFrame chart in SAPUI5.
My requirement was to disable/remove the default popover that appears when clicking on a data point in the chart.

Viz:VizFrame uiConfig="{applicationSet:'fiori'}"  id="VizChart"  vizType="column" 

After adding this Property, the default popover was removed automatically.

so question is Why Popover is Removed ?
Because in Fiori mode, SAP expects you to use your own popover or SmartPopover instead of the Viz standard one. That’s why the standard tooltip/popover is gone when you add this.

entry.title: Re: Email de notificação de entrega
entry.content:
Hello @ayglonfernando 

Good day

I understand what you require: in addition to the read receipt, you also want an email delivery confirmation (DSN – Delivery Status Notification) when a purchase order is sent via CL_BCS.

Here’s the gist and how to troubleshoot it:

1) A read receipt is not the same as delivery confirmation.

  • The read receipt relies on the recipient’s mail client, which they can ignore.
  • Delivery confirmation (DSN) relies on the SMTP infrastructure along the route. ABAP can request DSN, but only the mail servers can generate and return a “delivered OK” (many providers send failure DSNs but not success DSNs).

2) In ABAP (CL_BCS)

Make sure you explicitly request delivery status before send( 😞

DATA(lo_send) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).

lo_send->set_document( lo_doc ).

lo_send->add_recipient( lo_rec ).

 

" Request DSN / status mails (use constants available in your release)

lo_send->set_status_attributes(

  i_requested_status = 'ALL'    " SUCCESS/FAILURE/DELAY as policy allows

  i_status_mail      = 'ALWAYS' ).

 

lo_send->send( ).

 

Exact constants may vary by release; the key is: request DSN explicitly.

3) On the mail server side (usually the real blocker)

Ask your email/admin team to verify:

  • The SMTP relay employed by S/4 advertises the DSN extension, as indicated by EHLO showing DSN.
  • It is set up to send successful DSNs, not just NDRS or failures. Many relays, such as some Exchange/Office 365 configurations, don’t send successful DSNs by policy.
  • Your SAP sender/domain is permitted to receive those DSN reports (not filtered by anti-spam)..
  • On-prem/PCE only: in SCOT, the SMTP node has DSN/status options enabled, and the send/status jobs are scheduled.

In Public Cloud (SaaS), you don’t have SCOT access, so DSN behaviour is entirely up to your external mail provider.

4) Why does it work in ECC but not now

Most often, the SMTP path changes during the move (to a new relay/gateway that doesn’t issue successful DSNs). ABAP still requests DSN, but the server simply doesn’t send the “delivered” notification.

5) Practical paths forward

  • Confirm your code requests DSN (step 2) and your mail relay supports/permits successful DSNs (step 3).
  • If your provider won’t send successful DSNs, use operational alternatives:
    • rely on the outbound status/monitor (message transferred) and
    • treat bounces/NDRs as failures, or
    • Use your mail gateway’s delivery tracking report.

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI Assit content (Useful references)DSN (SMTP extension): RFC 3461 – SMTP Service Extension for Delivery Status Notifications. IETF DatatrackerRFC Editor

Read receipts (MDN): RFC 8098 – Message Disposition Notification (successor to RFC 3798). IETF Datatracker

 CL_BCS method: SET_STATUS_ATTRIBUTES documentation (requesting status/DSN). SAP Help Portal

Exchange/Office 365 DSNs: Microsoft docs (NDRs are the common DSN type). Microsoft Learn

Public Cloud output email (no SCOT; use Output Management/external mail): SAP S/4HANA Cloud Output Management overview. SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Discrepancy in Amount Calculation D
entry.content: One straight forward approach is to have one manual header condition in your pricing procedure which should be placed after the tax condition type.  This lets you correct the final invoice total without altering item-level tax logic. Also, check whether the "Group Condition" is ticked for that tax condition type which should also reduce rounding discrepancies across items.
